translations.english_saheeh: He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned and turned away
translations.english_hilali_khan: (The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم) frowned and turned away.
translations.english_rwwad: He frowned and turned away,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1853]- ʿAbdullāh, the son of Umm Maktūm.

translations.english_saheeh: Because there came to him the blind man,[1853] [interrupting].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Because there came to him the blind man (i.e. ‘Abdullâh bin Umm-Maktûm, who came to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم while he was preaching to one or some of the Quraish chiefs).
translations.english_rwwad: when the blind man came to him.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1854]- As a result of what he learns from you.

translations.english_saheeh: But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified[1854]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And how can you know that he might become pure (from sins)?
translations.english_rwwad: How would you know? Perhaps he might be purified,

translations.english_saheeh: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or he might receive admonition, and the admonition might profit him?
translations.english_rwwad: or he might take heed and benefit from the reminder?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1855]- i.e., without need of faith or need of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) . Here it is in reference to a certain influential member of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (ﷺ) had hoped to bring to Islām.

translations.english_saheeh: As for he who thinks himself without need,[1855]
translations.english_hilali_khan: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,
translations.english_rwwad: But he who was indifferent,

translations.english_saheeh: To him you give attention.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To him you attend;
translations.english_rwwad: you give him your full attention,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1856]- The Prophet (ﷺ) was responsible only for conveying the message, not for ultimate guidance.

translations.english_saheeh: And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.[1856]
translations.english_hilali_khan: What does it matter to you if he will not become pure (from disbelief: you are only a Messenger, your duty is to convey the Message of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: although you are not to be blamed if he does not purify himself.

translations.english_saheeh: But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
translations.english_hilali_khan: But as to him who came to you running,
translations.english_rwwad: But as for the one who came to you striving [for purification],

translations.english_saheeh: While he fears [Allāh],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And is afraid (of Allâh and His punishment).
translations.english_rwwad: and he fears Allah,

translations.english_saheeh: From him you are distracted.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Of him you are neglectful and divert your attention to another,
translations.english_rwwad: you let yourself to be distracted from him.

translations.english_saheeh: No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, (do not do like this); indeed it (this Qur’ân) is an admonition.
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed; this is a reminder –

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1857]- The revelation. Or "Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

translations.english_saheeh: So whoever wills may remember it.[1857]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So whoever wills, let him pay attention to it.
translations.english_rwwad: so whoever wills may give heed to it –

translations.english_saheeh: [It is recorded] in honored sheets,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It is) in Records held (greatly) in honour (Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz),
translations.english_rwwad: on venerable pages,

translations.english_saheeh: Exalted and purified,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Exalted (in dignity), purified,
translations.english_rwwad: exalted and purified,

translations.english_saheeh: [Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
translations.english_hilali_khan: In the hands of scribes (angels).
translations.english_rwwad: [preserved] in the hands of angel-scribes,

translations.english_saheeh: Noble and dutiful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Honourable and obedient.
translations.english_rwwad: honorable and obedient.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1858]- i.e., those who deny Allāh's message.

translations.english_saheeh: Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;[1858] how disbelieving is he.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Be cursed (the disbelieving) man! How ungrateful he is!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe to man; how ungrateful he is!

translations.english_saheeh: From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?
translations.english_hilali_khan: From what thing did He create him?
translations.english_rwwad: From what did He create him?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1859]- His proportions, provisions, life span, etc.

translations.english_saheeh: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;[1859]
translations.english_hilali_khan: From Nutfah (male and female semen drops) He created him and then set him in due proportion.
translations.english_rwwad: He created him from a drop of semen and proportioned him,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1860]- Into this world (i.e., his birth) . It may also refer to life itself, which has been made easier by Allāh's guidance.

translations.english_saheeh: Then He eased the way for him;[1860]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then He makes the Path easy for him.
translations.english_rwwad: then He made the way easy for him;

translations.english_saheeh: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.[1861]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then He causes him to die and puts him in his grave.
translations.english_rwwad: then He caused him to die and be buried;

translations.english_saheeh: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then when it is His Will, He will resurrect him (again).
translations.english_rwwad: then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

translations.english_saheeh: No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but (man) has not done what He commanded him.
translations.english_rwwad: Yet he has not fulfilled what He commanded him.

translations.english_saheeh: Then let mankind look at his food -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then let man look at his food:
translations.english_rwwad: Let man consider the food he eats:

translations.english_saheeh: How We poured down water in torrents,
translations.english_hilali_khan: We pour forth water in abundance.
translations.english_rwwad: How We poured down rainwater in torrents,

translations.english_saheeh: Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We split the earth in clefts.
translations.english_rwwad: and caused the soil to split open [for sprouts],

translations.english_saheeh: And caused to grow within it grain
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We cause therein the grain to grow,
translations.english_rwwad: and cause grains to grow in it,

translations.english_saheeh: And grapes and herbage
translations.english_hilali_khan: And grapes and clover plants (i.e. green fodder for the cattle),
translations.english_rwwad: as well as grapes and fodder,

translations.english_saheeh: And olive and palm trees
translations.english_hilali_khan: And olives and date-palms,
translations.english_rwwad: and olive trees and date palms,

translations.english_saheeh: And gardens of dense shrubbery
translations.english_hilali_khan: And gardens dense with many trees,
translations.english_rwwad: and dense orchards,

translations.english_saheeh: And fruit and grass -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And fruits and herbage
translations.english_rwwad: and fruits and grass,

translations.english_saheeh: [As] enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
translations.english_rwwad: as provision for you and your livestock.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1862]- The piercing blast of the Horn which signals resurrection. Aṣ-Ṣākhkhah is also a name for the Day of Resurrection.

translations.english_saheeh: But when there comes the Deafening Blast[1862]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then when there comes As-Sâkhkhah (the second blowing of the Trumpet on the Day of Resurrection)
translations.english_rwwad: But when the Deafening Blast comes,

translations.english_saheeh: On the Day a man will flee from his brother
translations.english_hilali_khan: That Day shall a man flee from his brother,
translations.english_rwwad: on that Day everyone will flee from his sibling,

translations.english_saheeh: And his mother and his father
translations.english_hilali_khan: And from his mother and his father,
translations.english_rwwad: and from his mother and father,

translations.english_saheeh: And his wife and his children,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And from his wife and his children.
translations.english_rwwad: and from his wife and children.

arabic_text: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ شَأۡنٞ يُغۡنِيهِ
phonetic: 80.37 Likulli Amri'in Minhum Yawma'idhin Sha'nun Yughnīhi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1863]- i.e., to occupy him. He will be concerned only with himself, thus forgetting all others.

translations.english_saheeh: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.[1863]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Everyman that Day will have enough to make him careless of others.
translations.english_rwwad: On that day, everyone will have enough concern of his own.

translations.english_saheeh: [Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Some faces that Day will be bright (true believers of Islâmic Monotheism),
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day, some faces will be bright,

translations.english_saheeh: Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Laughing, rejoicing at good news (of Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: cheerful and rejoicing;

translations.english_saheeh: And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And other faces, that Day, will be dust-stained.
translations.english_rwwad: while other faces will be dust-stained,

translations.english_saheeh: Blackness will cover them.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Darkness will cover them.
translations.english_rwwad: covered in darkness.

translations.english_saheeh: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Such will be the Kafarah (disbelievers in Allâh, in His Oneness, and in His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, etc.), the Fajarah (wicked evil doers).
translations.english_rwwad: Such are the disbelievers, the wicked.
